answers.answer: That is ridiculous !!!! Seriously I had the same EXACT situation! They kept me over night and induced me the next day! I was 38 weeks! It could be dangerous for baby. Preclamsia is what you have. I would demand to stay and be monitored

I don't mean to scare you but, baby will be fine, its you that could have a stroke. If I was you I would do nothing for the next 24hrs. Go to bed and rest, avoid salty foods, stay hydrated. I had severe preeclamplsia and my bp was 170/140 and I pretty much did nothing in hospital, just lay around for a couple of days trying to get it down before they started me on bp meds. If you get the severe headache, seeing spots etc etc or just want reassurance, just go back and tell them its worse.
I've been having severe headaches and seeing 'stars' I am just so scared. I always feel like I'm going to pass out I get so dizzy and light headed

I'd call up to labor and delivery and explain your symptoms. Let them know you'd feel safer being monitored. They have ways of getting ahold of your doctor a lot faster than you could, so they might be willing to let you stay until you stabilize or deliver, whichever comes first. The nurses are not your enemy and usually advocate for you.

I tried talking to people there and they said there was nothing the could do. I can't get out of bed I'm so sick and dizzy. And not to mention having severe headaches. I haven't been able to hardly eat at all..

I would call your personal doctor. They can override labor and delivery. The cure to pregnancy induced hypertension/preeclampsia is delivery.  You're 39 weeks.I was sent home when I was having a complication of latent phase labor.  I called the next day and spoke to my doctor who said "come to the hospital now."  Which I did.  The two nurses, one being a shift charge nurse (the boss) got reprimanded and I got a formal apology.  They made an error.  It happens.Anyway, I would absolutely call your ob/gyn and tell them about the dizziness, headaches . . .   are you seeing spots?  If your blood pressure went down at the hospital----  is that why they released you?  Seems kind of crazy they didn't just deliver you.BTW, prepare yourself.  I had high blood pressure during my first pregnancy and it went higher during delivery.  I had to stay an extra couple of days and I had a blood pressure cuff that automatically took my blood pressure on a schedule.  So in the middle of the night, my arm would get squeezed and wake me up.  But then it went down and never went back up again ----  even in later pregnancies.good luckOH< and that old saying "squeaky wheel gets the grease" . . .  be a super squeaky wheel as it is your health at stake here.  good luck

Honestly I would call 911 and be taken in by emergency because then they have to keep you at least 8hours for monitoring you should not be at home with blood pressure that high in your pregnancy! They should be fired for sending you home!

I've been seeing spots and just generally unwell feeling. I can hardly get out of bed from just general exhaustion. The doctor who made the decision to send me home was the doctor on call for the practice I go to although I have never seen him and I see the midwife who was very concerned.I'm just scared something could happen to me or even worse to my baby girl. Like I tried saying to them I'm 39 weeks and she's always measured big.. She's healthy. A lot of people are telling me to call a different hospital (I am lucky enough to have a few in the area). I just want to make sure we both are healthy and I'm afraid they aren't taking my symptoms very seriously .
And yes my blood pressure kind of relaxed when I was at the hospital. But I still had a lot of protein in my urine. I just don't know what to do...

Go to a different hospital since you are fortunate enough to do so! Never question yours or baby's health! If it's something that you can't get your mind off then you need to go to the hospital! And please do not drive yourself!

question: So I had my 39 week appointment.  My Blood pressure wax through the roof and a ton of protein in my urine. They Sent me to the hospital ASAP because of how high my BP was (180/104). The hospital monitored me for a short time then decided to send me home with a 24 hour urine collection. I'm so irate. They Had me hooked up to an IV and everything ):Now I'm scared something serious will happen to my baby girl with my BP being so high...
title: I'm never going back to the hospital (rant)
